metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Deep Learning (DL)
The deep learning revolution started around 2010.
content.html: The deep learning revolution started around 2010.

content.text: Since then, Deep Learning has solved many "unsolvable" problems.
content.html: Since then, Deep Learning has solved many "unsolvable" problems.

content.text: The deep learning revolution was not started by a single discovery. It more or less happened when several needed factors were ready:
content.html: The deep learning revolution was not started by a single discovery. It more or less happened when several needed factors were ready:

content.text: Neurons
Scientists agree that our brain has between 80 and 100 billion neurons.
content.html: Scientists agree that our brain has between 80 and 100 billion neurons.

content.text: These neurons have hundreds of billions connections between them.
content.html: These neurons have hundreds of billions connections between them.

content.text: Image credit: University of Basel, Biozentrum.
content.html: Image credit: University of Basel, Biozentrum.

content.text: Neurons (aka Nerve Cells) are the fundamental units of our brain and nervous system.
content.html: Neurons (aka Nerve Cells) are the fundamental units of our brain and nervous system.

content.text: The neurons are responsible for receiving input from the external world, for sending output (commands to our muscles), and for transforming the electrical signals in between.
content.html: The neurons are responsible for receiving input from the external world, for sending output (commands to our muscles), and for transforming the electrical signals in between.

content.text: Neural Networks
Artificial Neural Networks are normally called Neural Networks (NN).
content.html: Artificial Neural Networks are normally called Neural Networks (NN).

content.text: Neural networks are in fact multi-layer Perceptrons .
content.html: Neural networks are in fact multi-layer Perceptrons.

content.text: The perceptron defines the first step into multi-layered neural networks.
content.html: The perceptron defines the first step into multi-layered neural networks.

content.text: Neural Networks are the essence of Deep Learning .
content.html: Neural Networks are the essence of Deep Learning.

content.text: Neural Networks are one of the most significant discoveries in history.
content.html: Neural Networks are one of the most significant discoveries in history.

content.text: Neural Networks can solve problems that can NOT be solved by algorithms:
content.html: Neural Networks can solve problems that can NOT be solved by algorithms:

content.text: The Neural Network Model
Input data (Yellow) are processed against a hidden layer (Blue) and modified against another hidden layer (Green) to produce the final output (Red).
content.html: Input data (Yellow) are processed against a hidden layer (Blue) and modified against another hidden layer (Green) to produce the final output (Red).

content.text: Tom Mitchell
Tom Michael Mitchell (born 1951) is an American computer scientist and University Professor at the Carnegie Mellon University (CMU).
content.html: Tom Michael Mitchell (born 1951) is an American computer scientist and University Professor at the Carnegie Mellon University (CMU).

content.text: He is a former Chair of the Machine Learning Department at CMU.
content.html: He is a former Chair of the Machine Learning Department at CMU.

content.text: "A computer program is said to learn from experience E with respect to some class of tasks T and performance measure P, if its performance at tasks in T, as measured by P, improves with experience E."
content.html: "A computer program is said to learn from experience E with respect to some class of tasks T and performance measure P, if its performance at tasks in T, as measured by P, improves with experience E."

content.text: Tom Mitchell (1999)
content.html: Tom Mitchell (1999)

content.text: E: Experience (the number of times). T: The Task (driving a car). P: The Performance (good or bad).
content.html:
E: Experience (the number of times).
T: The Task (driving a car).
P: The Performance (good or bad).

content.text: The Giraffe Story
In 2015, Matthew Lai , a student at Imperial College in London created a neural network called Giraffe .
content.html: In 2015, Matthew Lai, a student at Imperial College in London created a neural network called Giraffe.

content.text: Giraffe could be trained in 72 hours to play chess at the same level as an international master.
content.html: Giraffe could be trained in 72 hours to play chess at the same level as an international master.

content.text: Computers playing chess are not new, but the way this program was created was new.
content.html: Computers playing chess are not new, but the way this program was created was new.

content.text: Smart chess playing programs take years to build, while Giraffe was built in 72 hours with a neural network.
content.html: Smart chess playing programs take years to build, while Giraffe was built in 72 hours with a neural network.

content.text: Deep Learning
Classical programming uses programs (algorithms) to create results:
content.html: Classical programming uses programs (algorithms) to create results:

content.text: Traditional Computing
Data + Computer Algorithm = Result
content.html: Data + Computer Algorithm = Result

content.text: Machine Learning uses results to create programs (algorithms):
content.html: Machine Learning uses results to create programs (algorithms):

content.text: Machine Learning
Data + Result = Computer Algorithm
content.html: Data + Result = Computer Algorithm

content.text: Machine Learning
Machine Learning is often considered equivalent with Artificial Intelligence.
content.html: Machine Learning is often considered equivalent with Artificial Intelligence.

content.text: This is not correct. Machine learning is a subset of Artificial Intelligence.
content.html: This is not correct. Machine learning is a subset of Artificial Intelligence.

content.text: Machine Learning is a discipline of AI that uses data to teach machines.
content.html: Machine Learning is a discipline of AI that uses data to teach machines.

content.text: "Machine Learning is a field of study that gives computers the ability to learn without being programmed."
content.html: "Machine Learning is a field of study that gives computers the ability to learn without being programmed."

content.text: Arthur Samuel (1959)
content.html: Arthur Samuel (1959)

content.text: Intelligent Decision Formula
The fact that computers can do this millions of times, has proven that computers can make very intelligent decisions.
content.html: The fact that computers can do this millions of times, has proven that computers can make very intelligent decisions.
